results.title: Surprising Amsterdam
results.creator_credit: Mark Fekkes, Machiel Amorison and Highlight Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Amsterdam is one of the world’s great cities, renowned for its historic and splendid museums and architecture, and its non-stop and exuberant night- life. The video shows us aspects of both medieval and modern Amsterdam. We are taken on a journey of the city’s famed canals. We visit the flower markets, the Van Gogh Museum, the 700 year old Dam Square, the Jewish section which houses the Anne Frank Museum and enjoy a Sunday afternoon in the beautiful gardens of the Vondelpark. Finally, after dark, we take a wander in the infamous “red-light” district.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Fekkes, Machiel Amorison and Highlight Productions

results.title: Surplus government asset
results.brief_description: This short narrated documentary is an experimental film study of the Sydney showgrounds- it’s history, and it’s current use during the Royal Easter Show. It studies the culture of the past and present, as well as how and why the Show attracts a huge amount of both city and country people to the grounds once a year. The film presents a different point of view of the grounds and the social context in which it functions.

results.title: Surgical dressings
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy. Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”
Demonstrates the application of surgical dressings in a naval hospital during World War II. Shows the correct procedures for setting-up the trolley containing instruments, dressings and disposal items. Shows how to minimise infection by ensuring procedures are as sterile as possible.

results.title: Surgery of varicose veins and ulceration
results.brief_description: The incidence of varicose veins and chronic ulcerations are given, and diagrams explain the venous supply to the legs and the abnormal conditions which can develop and cause trouble. The film explains pre-operative treatment. The operation itself is followed step by step and explanations are given of the various processes. The film ends with some close-up views of the instruments used, some of which were obtained from the Mayo Clinic.

results.title: Surgery in chest diseases
results.creator_credit: A. Reginald Dobson, British Council and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A study of a civilian Chest Surgery Centre, showing all the stages in medical treatment from early diagnosis by mass radiography to rehabilitation and final cure. A patient is diagnosed as having a cancer of the lung, and the operation for total removal of the lung is shown in detail.

results.title: Surfside
results.brief_description: “Just keep swimming,” was the motto of the forgetful fish, Dory, in Finding Nemo. Sun, sea and surf culture are central to the Australian lifestyle so it’s not surprising that so many of our essential pop culture moments are set beachside: surfboards, bikinis, scuba divers and dolphins have frequently featured on our screens. Mermaid adventure series H20: Just Add Water and its spin-off Mako Mermaids had massive international audiences during their original runs and a decade later have found a whole new generation of fans thanks to streaming services and viral parodies on TikTok.

results.title: Surfmovies
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms and Albie Thoms Productions
results.brief_description: Using clips from newsreels and surf movies, notably “Crystal Voyager”, made in Australia over the last fifty years, and interviewing filmmakers and others involved in the multi-million dollar Australian surfing industry, this documentary shows the close relationship between surf movies and the sport that usually see Australians as the world champions. Contains some b&w footage.

results.title: Surfing: the healing wave (A)
results.creator_credit: Tim Burns, Huey Benjamin and Neugh Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Aborigines come from all over Australia to compete in this unique and colorful event - the annual indigenous surfing contest at Fingal on the East Coast. Kyle Slabb, the narrator, is a young aboriginal surfer whose clan are hosting the event. He guides the viewer around the spectacular rivers and idyllic coastal reserves of his homelands, offering insights into traditional ways, dance and ceremony, and an understanding of his struggle to preserve these values in his modern life. The film is a lively and uplifting look at the positive steps taken by an indigenous community as it strives to achieve cultural continuity for future generations.

results.title: Surfing waves
results.creator_credit: John Davis and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the action and properties of waves. Aerial views of the seacoast are used to show diffraction and refraction of parallel wave fronts and laboratory examples further exemplify this point. The action of convergent and divergent lens systems is also demonstrated. Suitable for upper secondary level.
